jx.jx_en_mean: To unify and harmonize one's resources so as to perform with maximal effectiveness.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 集中心思：联合和协调自己的力量以最大的效率行动

entry.def: If people do something together, they do it with each other.

example.ex: We went on long bicycle rides together...
example.tran: 我们一起骑自行车长途旅行。

example.ex: He and I worked together on a book…
example.tran: 我和他合写了一本书。

entry.def: If things are joined together, they are joined with each other so that they touch or form one whole.

example.ex: Mix the ingredients together thoroughly...
example.tran: 把配料充分混合。

example.ex: She clasped her hands together on her lap...
example.tran: 她十指紧扣，放在膝上。

entry.def: If things or people are situated together, they are in the same place and very near to each other.

example.ex: The trees grew close together...
example.tran: 树木密密地长在一起。

example.ex: Ginette and I gathered our things together...
example.tran: 我和吉内特把东西收拢好。

entry.def: If a group of people are held or kept together, they are united with each other in some way.

example.ex: He has done enough to pull the party together...
example.tran: 他为使政党内部团结一致已经做得够多了。

example.ex: I want us all to be a happy family together…
example.tran: 我希望我们大家都能在一起，成为一个幸福的家庭。

entry.def: If two people are together, they are married or having a sexual relationship with each other.
entry.tran: (两人)结婚的，有性关系(或恋爱关系)的

example.ex: We were together for five years...
example.tran: 我们共同生活了 5 年。

example.ex: Towards the end of our time together he was impossible…
example.tran: 到我们在一起的最后那段时间，他简直令人难以忍受。

entry.def: If two things happen or are done together, they happen or are done at the same time.

example.ex: Three horses crossed the finish line together...
example.tran: 3 匹马同时越过终点线。

example.ex: 'Yes,' they said together.
example.tran: “是的，”他们齐声说。

entry.def: You use together when you are adding two or more amounts or things to each other in order to consider a total amount or effect.

example.ex: The two main right-wing opposition parties together won 29.8 per cent…
example.tran: 两大右翼反对党合计赢得 29.8% 的选票。

example.ex: The companies have together spent £300 million…
example.tran: 这些公司总计支出 3 亿英镑。

entry.def: If you say that two things go together, or that one thing goes together with another, you mean that they go well with each other or cannot be separated from each other.

example.ex: I can see that some colours go together and some don't...
example.tran: 我看得出有些颜色很相配，有些就不行。

example.ex: Winckelmann declared that art and freedom went together…
example.tran: 温克尔曼宣称艺术与自由不可分割。

entry.def: If you describe someone as together, you admire them because they are very confident, organized, and know what they want.

example.ex: She was very headstrong, and very together...
example.tran: 她非常倔强，又非常精干。

example.ex: I know on the surface I appear to be quite a together person…
example.tran: 我知道表面上我似乎自信能干。

entry.def: You use together with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.

example.ex: Every month we'll deliver the very best articles, together with the latest fashion and beauty news...
example.tran: 每个月我们都登载最好的文章，还有最新的时尚美容资讯。

example.ex: A famine started which, together with the war, carried away millions of lives…

sentences.sentence: "Our salaries put together couldn't pay for the damage"
"we couldn`t pay for the damages with all out salaries put together"
"the family that prays together stays together"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tōgædere, based on the preposition to + a West Germanic word related to gather. The adjective dates from the 1960s

sentences.cn: 总体来说，欧洲的食品和饮料批发市场与零售市场一样，也是增长缓慢。但如果把这些数字加在一起，便可以掩饰二者对立发展的趋势。
sentences.en: 0verall, Europe's wholesale market for food and drink is growing at the same sluggish pace as the retail market, but the figures, when added together, mask two opposing trends.

sentences.cn: 当古徳曼博士想去评估一对夫妻是否将继续在一起时，他会遨请他们到自己小岛上的休养场所进行一个更为长期的评估：两天而不是两秒。
sentences.en: When Dr. Gottman really wants to assess whether a couple will stay together, he invites them to his island retreat for a muck longer evaluation: two days, not two seconds.

Sentence.sentence: Teamwork improves with time: America's National Transportation Safety Board found that 73% of the incidents in its civil-aviation database occurred on a crew's first day of flying together.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Team-building skills are in short supply: Deloitte reports that only 12% of the executives they contacted feel they understand the way people work together in networks and only 21% feel confident in their ability to build cross-functional teams.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They suggest this indicates that dogs aren’t sensing emotions from a single feature, but piecing together information from all facial features just as humans do.

Sentence.sentence: So the formerly small supper after sundown becomes the big meal of the day, the only one at which the family has a chance to get together.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Meals are the foundation of the family, says Carole Counihan, a professor at Millersville University in Pennsylvania, so there was a very important interconnection between eating together and strengthening family ties.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Think of a 3-year-old lost in the pleasures of finding out what he can and cannot sink in the bathtub, a 5-year- old beside herself with the thrill of putting together strings of nonsensical words with her best friends, or an 11-year-old completely absorbed in a fascinating comic strip.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Becoming educated should not require giving up joy but rather lead to finding joy in new kinds of things: reading novels instead of playing with small figures, conducting experiments instead of sinking cups in the bathtub, and debating serious issues rather than stringing together nonsense words, for example.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Each interactive textbook is a media-heavy experience built from the ground up, and you can tell that it takes a respectable amount of manpower to put together each one.

Sentence.sentence: We tend to think of the Depression as a time when families pulled together to survive huge job losses, By 1932.

Sentence.sentence: For some, the hardships of life without steady work eventually overwhelmed their attempts to keep their families together

Sentence.sentence: Millions of American families may now be in the initial stage of their responses to the current crisis, working together and supporting one another through the early months of unemployment.

Sentence.sentence: An Indiana University study found that interracial roommates were three times as likely as two white roommates to no longer live together by the end of the semester.

Sentence.sentence: One of the great things about freshman housing is that, with some exceptions, the process throws you together randomly," said Undergraduate Assembly chairman Alec Webley
